title: Rugby Union of Russia
text:
Rugby Union of Russia () is the governing body for <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> in <a href="Russia">Russia</a>. It was founded in 1936 originally as the Rugby Union of the Soviet Union. The Rugby Union of Russia became affiliated to <a href="World%20Rugby">World Rugby</a> (previously known as the International Rugby Football Board, and still later as the International Rugby Board) in 1990.
Aims.
The Rugby Union of Russia set a goal for the <a href="Russia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Russian national team</a> to qualify for the <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2011 Rugby World Cup</a> in <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>, and make their first appearance in the tournament. The team succeeded in this quest, qualifying as <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20%E2%80%93%20Europe%20qualification">Europe 2</a> in Pool C, where one of their opponents was one of the country's main sporting rivals, the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States</a>. Further ahead, they have targeted being a top twelve rugby playing nation by <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2015</a>, and reaching the quarter finals stage of the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2019 Rugby World Cup</a> in <a href="Japan">Japan</a>.
